DEFECT.DESCRIPTION: Buffer overrun while writing to 'pix': the writable size is '((pcx->ymax+1))*((pcx->xmax+1))' bytes, but '2' bytes might be written.

KEYEVENT.MESSAGE: Invalid write to 'pix', (outside its writable range)
'pixbuf' is dereferenced, but may still be NULL

DEFECT.DESCRIPTION: Reading invalid data from 'p': the readable size is 'cinfo.output_width*3' bytes, but '2' bytes may be read.

KEYEVENT.MESSAGE: Invalid read from 'p', (outside its readable range)

DEFECT.DESCRIPTION: Buffer overrun while writing to 'q': the writable size is 'cinfo.output_width*cinfo.output_height*4' bytes, but '2' bytes might be written.

KEYEVENT.MESSAGE: Invalid write to 'q', (outside its writable range)

DEFECT.DESCRIPTION: Function uses '16432' bytes of stack: exceeds /analyze:stacksize '16384'. Consider moving some data to heap.
Function uses '32832' bytes of stack: exceeds /analyze:stacksize '16384'. Consider moving some data to heap.
Arithmetic overflow: Using operator '*' on a 4 byte value and then casting the result to a 8 byte value. Cast the value to the wider type before calling operator '*' to avoid overflow (io.2).

Function uses '524320' bytes of stack: exceeds /analyze:stacksize '16384'. Consider moving some data to heap.

KEYEVENT.MESSAGE: 'pic' is an In/Out argument to 'memset' (declared at c:\program files (x86)\microsoft visual studio\2017\community\vc\tools\msvc\14.16.27023\include\vcruntime_string.h:60)
'pic' should not be NULL, because this is not consistent with the SAL annotation on 'memset'
